description: just download it it's the best i have ever used

Poor UI/UX
No bookmarks/ table of contents
Great for vim users and on low-resource machines

the reason this is NOT installed by default is because it is so minimal in it's exposed front-end functions that it is a pain for casual users to get started with it. SO much faster than the default under a GNOME desktop-environment.
definately worth a try. 
tip for devs > maybe offer a separate plugin to expose at least the basic front-end functions so as to appeal to the general public.
no bloat. Just install the add-ons for the file types you need and enjoy a fast and clean document viewer.
Although it lacks any ui therefore you must use keyboard controls which are somewhat similar to vi.
summary: Actually one the best document viewers out there

description: make sure you customize your zathurarc config file. its a great lightweight program.

This application is amazing IF you like minimal applications and using your keyboard for navigation.
There are no unnecessary UI components so it might take some getting used too for some users.
when searching text with '/' command, can not find the rotated text in the pdf.

I like Zathura for when I just want to read a PDF. Learning the shortcuts (which are like vim key-bindings) took a little getting used to, but it was worth it to have a quiet readings experience. PDFs load super fast and navigation has zero lag-time.
Very useful to display alongside vim or emacs while you edit tex.
It's just work! Amazing!
Wow, this is fast and excellent. I use it to open man pages. You need to understand this is totally keyboard centric with a VIM-like UI otherwise you will just be confused...

Any of you of a certain age who played the Hitchhiker's Guide rpg will be familiar with waking up in a dark room, and spending 40 minutes before finding the 'Turn on the light' command.
I wanted to read a comic, and as Zathura had a good score, I installed it, plus the CB plugin.
40 minutes later, I still have a dark window, and no comic.

There is no Help in the single dropdown menu. The single dropdown item takes you to the website, where the 'The documentation is currently being reworked and will be available soon.'
I feel the website is missing a sign on the home-page saying 'Beware of the leopard'.

I have a cryptic [No name] in the lower left window - neither right or left clicks do anything, along with ctrl-N, ctrl-O, ctrl-1 (to 9, just in case), for ctrl_New and ctrl_Open.

As expected, drag'n'drop doesn't work either.

Using right-click on the file and Open With, for either Zathura or #Zathura (I have no idea how there are now two options) will open a new black window, with the same deep impenetrable [No name] window as documented above.

I'm now an hour in, and tbh, enjoying the challenge has passed - Google search it is.

https://www.mankier.com/1/zathura

so, it appears you need the full path to the file as a string to open a file - you can't open the parent directory and select a file.
I've now tried every variation on "path/filename" I can (with quotes, without, full path, ~path, just the filename), and every time I either get a red 'Too many arguments', a red 'No arguments given' (?), or just back to the black [No name] screen.
No feedback, no error message, nothing to give me any clues.

I'm sure the other reviewers are correct that this is a great low overhead doc viewer, but in all honesty, a vertical learning curve and a complete disregard for new users means I can't recommend this at all.
i can pdf, nice

Cannot start in fullscreen.
No way to eliminate gap in between pages when viewing like in a book mode.
No way to remove toolbar on start up.
:(

It displays the pages and that's it. 
Keyboard controls, but all you need 99% of the time is asdjkJK and Tab.
It's a bit buggy on my gnome wayland sessions, I need to fullscreen with F11 and go back to have everything work.
Another thing that's always buggy is the config, if it contains errors zathura doesn't do a good job alerting you to them, it just spazzes out. It's very annoying before you craft a trusty zathurarc.
I always end up having to compile the plugin for epub support from source, but it's very easy and never failed for me.
Despite the cb support, zathura is a poor comic reader due to it's handling of documents with various page sizes.
Once you get past all these annoyances, the performance, controls, amazing collapsing index and recolor features will easily win you over.
Permite hacer cosas que otros programas no lo hacen.  Invito a que lo prueben y comprobarán la versatilidad de este programa.
Buscar un tutorial en YouTube o escribir ~$ man zathura en la consola para que aparezcan los comandos. Es un lector excelente.
summary: Hay que buscar un tutorial para aprender a utilizarla. Muy buena

description: Simplemente sencillo de usar y versatil
Je n'ai pas compris comment aller à une page précise. En plus, impossible d'afficher la table des matières.
summary: Je n'ai pas compris comment aller à une page précise

description: Fedora 40. Утилита не работает.
